text:
There is another cognitive advantage to routine as well.  

Once the mental work shifts to the basal ganglia, mental space is freed.  

This allows us to autopilot one essential activity.  

We can actively engage in another without losing focus.  

Charles Duhigg, author of The Power of Habit, says,  

“The brain starts working less and less.”  

“The brain can almost completely shut down.”  

This is a real advantage.  

It means we have mental activity for something else.  

To some, routine sounds like where creativity goes to die.  

It feels like the ultimate exercise in boredom.  

We use the word as a synonym for dull and bland.  

We say, “It has just become routine for me.”  

Routines can indeed become this—the wrong routines.  

But the right routines enhance innovation and creativity.  

They give us an energy rebate.  

Instead of spending discipline on the same decisions,  

we embed decisions into our routine.  

This allows us to channel discipline toward other essential activities.  

Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi studied how creative people use routines.  

He shows how they free up their minds.  

“Most creative individuals find out early their best rhythms,” he says.  

They stick to routines for sleeping, eating, and working.  

They follow these even when tempted otherwise.  

“They wear comfortable clothes,” he says.  

“They interact only with congenial people.”  

“They do only things they think are important.”  

Such idiosyncrasies may not be endearing to others.  

But personalizing action patterns frees the mind.  

It helps avoid expectations that demand attention.  

This allows intense concentration on what counts.  

One CEO in Silicon Valley has a boring routine.  

He holds a three-hour meeting at 9:00 A.M. once a week.  

It is never missed or rescheduled.  

It is mandatory for everyone.  

Executives know not to schedule travel that conflicts.  

If it is 9:00 A.M. on Monday, everyone will be there.  

It is a discipline.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Establishing the right routines can enhance creativity and innovation by freeing mental space for new ideas while automating essential tasks.
